item.title: Superstar Ston Cold
item.description: Stone Cold Steve Austin, known for his rebellious persona and iconic catchphrase "Austin 3:16," is a legendary figure in WWE history. Renowned for his intense brawls and unparalleled charisma, Austin revolutionized professional wrestling during the Attitude Era, becoming a multiple-time WWE Champion and a symbol of anti-establishment defiance

item.title: The Rock
item.description: Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson, a charismatic powerhouse, transcended WWE to become a Hollywood icon. Known for his electrifying performances and signature eyebrow raise, he is a multiple-time WWE Champion and one of the most beloved figures in entertainment

item.title: The Undertaker
item.description: With an ominous presence and unmatched longevity, The Undertaker is a WWE legend. Renowned for his eerie persona, streak of WrestleMania victories, and unmatched intimidation factor, he remains one of the most respected and feared competitors in wrestling history

item.title: John cena
item.description: John Cena, the face of WWE for over a decade, is a 16-time World Champion and pop culture phenomenon. With his mantra of "Hustle, Loyalty, and Respect," Cena became a symbol of perseverance and a role model for millions worldwide, both in and out of the ring

item.title: Hulk Hogan
item.description: A true icon of professional wrestling, Hulk Hogan defined an era with his larger-than-life persona and unmatched charisma. As a multiple-time WWE Champion and the centerpiece of Hulkamania, he transcended the sport to become a global phenomenon and a household name

item.title: Triple H
item.description: Triple H, also known as "The Game," is a WWE Hall of Famer and one of the most influential figures behind the scenes. As a 14-time World Champion and master strategist, he dominated WWE both as a competitor and as an executive, shaping the landscape of sports entertainment for decades

item.title: Ric Flair
item.description: "The Nature Boy" Ric Flair, a 16-time World Champion, epitomizes the essence of professional wrestling. With his flamboyant style, unmatched in-ring skill, and iconic catchphrase "Woo," Flair set the standard for excellence and became one of the most celebrated figures in the history of the sport
